com.cmput301w17t07.moody

Class MoodImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w17t07.moody.MoodImage

  • public class MoodImage
extends java.lang.Object
    The MoodImage model class for the Moody application. The MoodImage is a class object used to store user's mood image data efficiently on the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoodImage() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.graphics.Bitmap decodeImage()
      This method decodes the encodedImage string that is stored on the Moody application's server and allows the image to be displayed from the server in the ViewMoodActivity.
      java.lang.String encodeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap moodImage)
      This method encodes and compresses a user's supplied bitmap image for appropriate storage on the application's server.

      java.lang.String getmoodID()

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)

      • decodeImage

        public android.graphics.Bitmap decodeImage()
        This method decodes the encodedImage string that is stored on the Moody application's server and allows the image to be displayed from the server in the ViewMoodActivity.
        Returns:
        bitmap The decoded bitmap image from the server

      • encodeImage

        public java.lang.String encodeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap moodImage)
        This method encodes and compresses a user's supplied bitmap image for appropriate storage on the application's server. Images stored on the server are all under 65536 bytes.
        Logic for compression of the image is from:
        link: http://blog.csdn.net/harryweasley/article/details/51955467
        Author: Harry Weasley
        Taken by: Xin Huang 2017/03/11
        Logic for encoding of image string was based upon:
        link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12796579/how-to-send-image-bitmap-to-server-in-android-with-multipart-form-data-json
        Author: Carnal
        Taken by: Michael Simion 2017/03/10
        Parameters:
        moodImage - The user's supplied image for his or her mood
        Returns:
        encodedImage The encodedImage string that will be stored within the object on the server

      • getmoodID

        public java.lang.String getmoodID()
